awd_titl_txt: Development and Field Verification of Sorption/Oxidation    Models for Soluble Manganese Removal by Oxide-Coated        Filtration Systems
awd_abstract_narration: This is an award to provide support for a project, the                          objective of which is to devise and verify mathematical                         models that characterize the removal of soluble manganese                       from natural water by filter media that have become coated                      with oxides of manganese.  The mathematical models to be                        devised will be based upon fundamental principles of                            surface chemistry and mass transfer.  Model parameters                          will be experimentally evaluated at laboratory-scale, and                       the models verified by conduct of field-scale research at                       the City of Durham, North Carolina's Williams Water                             Treatment Plant and at the Blacksburg-Christiansburg-                           Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University Water                       Treatment Plant.                                                                                                                                                Results of this project are expected to provide a more                          fundamental understanding of the mechanisms by which                            manganese in solution is removed from water by contact                          with filter media coated with the contaminant's oxide.                          This knowledge may be applied to improving the engineering                      design of water treatment processes for removal of soluble                      manganese.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems

inst.inst_name: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
